channel.title: Aqeedah of Muhammad ibn Abdul Wahaab
channel.description: Our weekly class on the book "Explanation of the 'Aqeedah of the Imaam, the Reformer, Muhammad Ibn 'Abdul-Wahhab" as explained by the Noble Shaykh, Dr. Saalih Ibn Fawzaan al-Fawzaan. The book is read by our brother Abu Maryam and explained by our brother Ustaadh Abul 'Abbaas Moosaa Richardson.

channel.itunes:summary: Our weekly class on the book "Explanation of the 'Aqeedah of the Imaam, the Reformer, Muhammad Ibn 'Abdul-Wahhab" as explained by the Noble Shaykh, Dr. Saalih Ibn Fawzaan al-Fawzaan. The book is read by our brother Abu Maryam and explained by our brother Ustaadh Abul 'Abbaas Moosaa Richardson.

item.title: 13 False Claims Against a Great Scholar
item.description:
A summary of 13 false claims made by Sulaymaan ibn Suhaym against Shaykh al-Islaam Muhammad ibn 'Abdil-Wahhaab. Ustaadh Moosaa Richardson summarizes and explains some of them, highlighting how the scholars are often lied upon, and the lies are spread without investigation, while valid academic criticism of unqualified "TV-star" type preachers may be rejected since we must "hear both sides of the story!"
An important question is posed: Why are we required to give former rodeo clowns the chance to explain their legacy of babbling about Islaam without knowledge, while requesting verification of claims made against bonafide scholars is "political" or not even a consideration? Recorded on 1436-08-12 at al-Masjid al-Awwal in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.

item.title: Conclusion to the Letter to Qaseem
item.description: This is the final class of the course based on the 'Aqeedah of Shaykh al Islaam Muhammad ibn Abdil-Wahhaab. It was recorded at al-Masjid al-Awwal in Pittsburgh on 1436.07.28.
item.itunes:author: al-Masjid al-Awwal (1MM)

item.itunes:summary: This is the final class of the course based on the 'Aqeedah of Shaykh al Islaam Muhammad ibn Abdil-Wahhaab. It was recorded at al-Masjid al-Awwal in Pittsburgh on 1436.07.28.

item.title: Ordering Good & Forbidding Evil Part 2
item.description: Abu Maryam Nafees Moorefield reads the explanation of Shaykh Saalih al-Fowzaan (may Allaah preserve him) of the 'Aqeedah of Shaykh al-Islaam Muhammad ibn 'Abdil-Wahhaab (may Allaah have Mercy on him) on the topic of ordering good and forbidding evil (part 2). Moosaa Richardson supervises and adds commentary to help understand the material. More deviant principles of al-Ikhwaan al-Muslimoon (the so-called Muslim Brotherhood) are dismantled, putting Islamic terminology back in its place. Ikhwanis like Haitham Haddad (UK) and Waleed Basyouni (USA) claim that voting in democratic elections is ordering good and forbidding evil! Recorded 1436.07.21 at al-Masjid al-Awwal in Pittsburgh.
item.itunes:author: al-Masjid al-Awwal (1MM)

item.title: Aqeedah: Ordering Good & Forbidding Evil
item.description: Abu Maryam Nafees Moorefield reads the explanation of Shaykh Saalih al-Fowzaan (may Allaah preserve him) of the 'Aqeedah of Shaykh al-Islaam Muhammad ibn 'Abdil-Wahhaab on the topic of ordering good and forbidding evil. Moosaa Richardson supervises and adds commentary to help understand the material. At the conclusion is and end-game argument to counter the "Mawaazanaat" pipe-dream of the followers of the deviant sect, al-Ikhwaan al-Muslimoon (the so-called Muslim Brotherhood). Recorded 1436.07.14 at al-Masjid al-Awwal.

item.title: Aqeedah: Eemaan & the Murji'ah Part 2
item.description: Part 2 of Shaykh Saalih al Fowzaan's clarification of eemaan and his refutation of the deviant Murji'ah Cult. From the Aqeedah of Shaykh al Islaam Muhammad ibn 'Abdil-Wahhaab. Nafees Moorefield reads and Moosaa Richardson explains. Dated 1436.07.06

item.title: Aqeedah Class1436.02.06
item.description: This is Shaykh Dr. Saalih al-Fawzaan’s Sharh read by our brother Aboo Maryam with additional commentary and benefit from our teacher Abul ‘Abbaas Moosaa Richardson. This lesson with our teacher Moosaa Richardson contains a beneficial refutation of deviant groups who claim that using Aahaad narrations in ‘Aqeedah is unacceptable along with an answer to those who claim that refutations harden the heart.
